content:
Diagnosis:	Left breast medullary carcinoma

Management:	12 Apr 2024 Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

Histology:	Grade 3 medullary carcinoma, 1.8cm, pT1cN0(0/2)M0
		TILs 80%, PDL1 positive (CPS 90)
		ER/PR negative, HER2 negative

Current Situation:	Post-operative review prior to adjuvant therapy

[redacted name] is a 42-year-old lady who underwent breast conserving surgery following diagnosis of a left breast cancer. The surgery was uncomplicated and she has recovered well with good wound healing. Her arm mobility is now back to normal and she has no ongoing pain issues.

The histology confirms a triple negative medullary carcinoma with high TILs and PDL1 expression. Given these features, I have recommended adjuvant chemotherapy with 4 cycles of AC followed by 12 weeks of weekly paclitaxel. She understands the aims of treatment and the common side effects which we discussed in detail.

We will proceed with chemotherapy port insertion next week and commence treatment the following week. She will be reviewed regularly during chemotherapy and have a mammogram arranged for 6 months post completion of all treatment?

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: TILs 80%, PDL1 positive (CPS 90), ER/PR negative, HER2 negative

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy, uncomplicated
Histology confirms Grade 3 medullary carcinoma, pT1cN0(0/2)M0, TILs 80%, PDL1 positive

patient_facts.value: Normal arm mobility, good wound healing

status_updates.value: Early stage triple negative medullary breast cancer post successful surgery. Planning to commence adjuvant chemotherapy.
Plan for adjuvant chemotherapy with 4 cycles AC followed by 12 weeks weekly paclitaxel
Mammogram to be arranged for 6 months post completion of treatment
Chemotherapy port insertion next week, regular review during chemotherapy
